meanings.definition: To produce saliva in anticipation of food
meanings.sent1: Whenever I see a delicious meal, I start to salivate.
meanings.sent2: Dogs often salivate when they smell something tasty cooking in the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The thought of pizza makes me salivate like a hungry bear.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of freshly baked cookies made her salivate uncontrollably.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the juicy burger made his mouth salivate with hunger.

meanings.definition: To show great interest or desire in something
meanings.sent1: I always salivate over the latest tech gadgets.
meanings.sent2: She would salivate at the thought of going shopping for new clothes.
meanings.sent3: The kids salivate over the idea of getting ice cream after dinner.
meanings.sent4: The bookworm would salivate over the prospect of a new novel release.
meanings.sent5: The fashionista couldn't help but salivate over the designer handbag in the store window.
